holidays.name: Do a Grouch a Favor Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to cheering up the grumpiest grouch you know — because everyone deserves a little kindness, especially the curmudgeons.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from internet communities encouraging positivity and goodwill in everyday life.
holidays.funFact: Trying to make a grouch smile on this day can sometimes backfire — making their grumpiness even grouchier!

holidays.name: Cherry Pie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the delicious, sweet, and tangy goodness of cherry pie — a classic dessert that’s perfect for any occasion.
holidays.origin: This tasty treat day was created by pie enthusiasts to honor the cherry pie’s rich history dating back to European settlers.
holidays.funFact: The largest cherry pie ever made weighed over 17,000 pounds and was baked in Michigan in 2014!

holidays.name: No Brainer Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day encouraging people to let go of overthinking and just do something simple, fun, or spontaneous.
holidays.origin: Popularized in self-help and productivity circles as a reminder that sometimes the best choice is the easiest one.
holidays.funFact: No Brainer Day often inspires viral memes poking fun at obvious decisions all around the internet.

holidays.name: Innovation Day (Lithuania)
holidays.description: A day celebrated in Lithuania to honor creativity, new inventions, and the spirit of innovation across all fields.
holidays.origin: Established by the Lithuanian Innovation Centre to promote awareness and interest in science and technology.
holidays.funFact: Lithuania is known for inventing the first-ever reusable metal space rocket parts in the early 2000s!
